comments.creator: launchpad@shinyblue.net
comments.author: launchpad@shinyblue.net
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.15pre) Gecko/20110209 Ubuntu/10.10 (maverick) Namoroka/3.6.15pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.15pre) Gecko/20110209 Ubuntu/10.10 (maverick) Namoroka/3.6.15pre

When a button is clicked to submit a form, TWO HTTP requests are issued simultaneously, but the response from the first is ignored.

On forms that use a nonce, this means the dropped response is the valid one, making the site unusable.

I've googled and read that Firebug can cause this problem, so I disabled it and tried again but I get the same results. I don't have any other extensions installed that would cause a problem (no link checkers, no "speed up your browser" things, no virus checkers...)


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:

Here is a real example form that causes me the headache: (excuse the invalid XHTML, it is valid in source, but Firefox's View Source routine spams it ;-) )

<form method='get' >
	<input type='hidden' name='oncelerToken' value=2fed07884a4a8cb57d2cfa2f86dbbfba />
	<button class='awesome secondary' name='do' value='surveyLogOut'  >Log out of survey</button>
	<button class='awesome secondary' name='do' value='showLogs'  >Show Logs</button>
</form>

Actual Results:  
Two HTTP requests are logged at the same time on the server. As the "oncelerToken" is a nonce, the php script that processes the request ignores the second.

Expected Results:  
One request only should have been generated.
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.15pre) Gecko/20110209 Ubuntu/10.10 (maverick) Namoroka/3.6.15pre

I've googled and read that Firebug can cause this problem, so I disabled it and tried again but I get the same results. I don't have any other extensions installed that would cause a problem (no link checkers, no "speed up your browser" things, no virus checkers...)

</form>

Actual Results:  
Two HTTP requests are logged at the same time on the server. As the "oncelerToken" is a nonce, the php script that processes the request ignores the second.

Expected Results:

comments.creator: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.text: Do you disabled Firebug in the addon manager and restarted Firefox ?
comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.raw_text: Do you disabled Firebug in the addon manager and restarted Firefox ?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Do you disabled Firebug in the addon manager and restarted Firefox ?

yes.

First I tried turning firebug off with firebug's controls, to no effect.

Second I disabled the Firebug add-on from the add-ons dialogue. Restarted, and tried again. Bug still there.

Third, I uninstalled Firebug (and Page Speed which is Firebug dependent), restarted and tried again. Bug still there.
comments.creator: launchpad@shinyblue.net
